text: [Music]
imagine you're assigned two creative
tasks at the same time that both require
creative thinking would your approach to
be work on one until it's complete and
then proceed to the other or would you
be more inclined to work on the first
until you get bored and then move to the
second Research indicates that there is
a third way that is more effective if
you have two creative tasks to complete
switching between them at regular
planned intervals will yield the most
fresh and creative ideas investigators
found that switching at your own
volition may not generate the best
outcomes because when addressing
problems that require creativity we
often reach a dead end without realizing
it we can find ourselves circling around
the same ineffective ideas while not
recognizing when it's time to move on in
contrast regularly switching back and
forth between two tasks allows you to
reset your thinking and look at each
task from fresh angles research shows
that participants who were instructed to
continually switch back and forth
between two problems at a fixed interval
were more likely to find the correct
answer to both problems than
participants who switched at their own
discretion additional studies found that
participants who were instructed to
switch back and forth between two
creative tasks generated the most novel
ideas in contrast participants who
didn't step away from a task at regular
intervals were more likely to offer
ideas that were very similar to those
already proposed they failed to
recognize when rigid thinking crept in
while they might have felt that they
were on a roll the reality was that
without the breaks afforded by continual
task switching their actual progress was
limited similarly other Studies have
found that brief breaks during creative
tasks can increase the variety of ideas
generated so when working on tasks that
would benefit from creative thinking
consciously insert breaks to refresh
your approach set them at regular
intervals if you're hesitant to break
away because you feel that you're on a
roll be mindful that it might be a false
impression finally don't feel guilty
about taking breaks and switching tasks
especially when you're feeling stuck
doing so may be the best use of your
time
[Music]
